title: Irving Stringham
summary: Washington Irving Stringham (December 10, 1847 – October 5, 1909) was an American mathematician born in Yorkshire, New York. He was the first person to denote the natural logarithm as ln ⁡ ( x ) {\displaystyle \ln(x)} where x {\displaystyle x} is its argument. The use of ln ⁡ ( x ) {\displaystyle \ln(x)} in place of log e ⁡ ( x ) {\displaystyle \log _{e}(x)} is commonplace in digital calculators today.
